embeds.title: Hole Up
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 12 (16) **Block** :p_block:.
Gain 2 **Weak** :p_weak:.

messages.content: Hole up, wait a minuite.
it's a strong block card
you can partially mitigate the downside with determination and playing the card last
and Hermit also has virtue
it's a card I generally like to see
block common that has a big number but a reasonable downside
it gains a strength from determination, but it usually does result in a net loss of damage on the turns where you are weak
self debuffs are interesting because card order matters
"2 weak" really means weak all of next turn, plus the rest of this turn
if you play it last, it doesn't affect your damage this turn at all
4 block upgrade is pretty big for a 1 cost card

The weak isn’t that big of a deal if you are playing this as the last card during your turn (your debuffs get reduced at the end of turn by 1 stack, effectively making you weak for only 1 turn). You can also use it alongside determination, spray n' pray, and sources of vulnerable in a perma-weak strategy as a form of damage scaling as well as strong front-loaded mitigation. This also just provides a very efficient amount of block per energy, and can really help you deal with nasty attacks and prevent chip damage over the course of a run. Do be careful about using this card in act 1, where you really need to race enemies and deal damage as quickly as possible, and where even just 1 turn of weak can cost you a lot of health. I find that it gets much better once you enter acts 2, 3, and 4, where fights aren’t so focused on racing anymore. Can also be awkward to sequence with dead-on cards, since you may need to play this first if it is blocking the middle of your hand, and then you are dealing with 2 turns of weak. The upgrade is very solid, a +4 on a 1 energy card, but I usually wouldn’t prioritize that until later in the run, since you normally want better damage in acts 1 and 2 to end fights more quickly. Usually a very solid option for your front-loaded mitigation, and can even play nicely into some scaling strategies for late game.
Frontloaded block is nice on hermit, and having a really good one in the common pool is nice. This and <body armor> are really good frontloaded block tools for hermit.

embeds.title: Body Armor
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Discard a card.
Gain 5 (7) **Block** :p_block:.
If it was a non-Attack, gain 5 (7) **Block** :p_block: again.

messages.content: Body armor being slightly less block but scaling 2x with dex from maintenance, and they each have their downsides. Hole up lowers your damage potential through weak, and body armor through eating card draw.
The weak can be played off of with something like <determination> or <low profile>, or mitigated through <weak vulnerable frail type=relic rarity=rare> or <virtue>

embeds.title: Determination
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever a debuff is applied to you, gain 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.

embeds.title: Low Profile
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 7 (9) **Block** :p_block:.
Gains 4 (5) additional **Block** :p_block: for each of your debuffs.

embeds.title: Horseshoe
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / All / Downfall

Whenever you gain **Weak** :p_weak:, **Frail** :p_frail: or **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:, gain 1 less.
*Lucky charm. Somebody is gonna be missing this.*

embeds.title: Virtue
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

**Retain**.
Reduce each of your debuffs by 1 (2).

messages.content: Hermit actually has some pretty good common block cards (feint is also common, as well as manifest) but lacks the scaling options and utility that something like the silent has. Hermit's defensive powers are all very situational (cursed cloak requires curses, adapt requires exhausting) so he lacks the late game defensive scaling as well.
The best defensive scaling option it has would probably be maintenance, which feels really awkward when the strike half of it feels like it gets very little value.
Overall hermit honestly doesn't have an absolutely horrible defensive game as one would think, it's just very convoluted.
Most of hermit's best cards have some sort of weird downside attached to them, and that is especially true for his defensive cards.
However if you build to get around those downsides you can get some truly wacky stuff.
The deeper I look into the character's defensive options, the more I realize the uniqueness it holds.
If the cards line up (literally) you can actually run hyper defensive hermit builds.

But to a newer player the character looks really weak defensively. Hermit has really good burst options and pretty good damage scaling, but the important part is that this is apparent to the player on a surface level. You can look at bruise and say "this will let me deal more damage" and magnum and say "this is a strength payout". The same cannot be said about hermit's defensive packages.
With a bit of ingenuity and maybe a character specialist or two, this character is probably better than watcher (lol)
Okay jokes aside, hermit's defensive capabilities are all very unintuitive, but when mastered this character can actually be pretty good at blocking.

Dont forget Vantage, It works really well with the other block commons which most have big upgrades, hole up and body armor both have +4 block upgrades, dive has an almost necessary upgrade, low profile has a 3-5 block upgrade depending on the deck and Vantage itself upgrades really nicely
I´ve had runs that I´ve gotten by on block by spaming front-loaded block cards because they are just so good in general, if you have enough offense you can get you all the way

I love this about the character, at the start of every run I always have to keep in mind, "how am I gonna block this time? What kind of weird combination of stuff can I concoct?" having to consider when you should not take a shadow cloak is quite interesting
The best ""defensive power"" Hermit has is Eternal Form, because It enables card spamming strategies that work well with the block commons
I feel like the strike part of maintenance is useful for act 1 and the dex part gets better over the course of the run

The strike part of maintenance makes me less apprehensive of picking It during act 1 so I can already start building the deck around dexterity early and kinda mitigate the problem of picking a scaling card early
Something to not underestimate in Hermit´s block options is that he has 2 really good weak applying cards in Glare and ghostly presence that can put in a lot of work in late game fights
We need a Hermit specialist
really do
in general, we need a lot more modded character specialists
so it looks like this?
made this graph in 5 minutes
Yes because you delete strikes :sencheese:
Or at least take other non strike attacks
yup
not only that, +3(4) damage is not enough scaling late game
Hermit has tons of better ways to scale damage
well it can be, if you have strong enough payouts for that damage
strikes are DEFINITELY NOT
yeah, I was talking about It in the context of strike
